body.p: You can create inline links in the content of a DITA topic using the xref element. To insert a link in Author mode, click the link button on the DITA Toolbar .

section.title: Linking using keys
section.p: To make links easier to manage, you may choose to use keys for linking, rather than creating direct links to topics. By using keys, you avoid creating a direct dependency between topics, which can make it easier to reuse topics in different publications. It can also be helpful in verifying the completeness of a publication, by ensuring that a publication map provides a key definition for every key reference used in the content.

Links based on keys require two pieces. The first piece is a key definition, which assigns a key to a topic so that other topics can link to it. The second piece is a key reference, which is created in an xref element and specifies the key to link to. Thus the key reference points to a key definition, and the key definition points to a topics.
Key definitions are created in maps, as an element on the topicref element that points to a topic. Thus a key reference points to a key definition on a topicref that points to a topic.

This allows you to assign a particular key to one topic in one map and to another topic in another map. When a topic that links to that key is used in each of these maps, the links work correctly in both maps.

Note that you can define more than one key on the same topic reference. Topics can link to any of they keys. This can allow you to have topics that link to different keys link to the same topic in one map and to different topics in another map.

section.title: Adding a key to a map
section.p: To add a key to a map:

ol.li: In the DITA Maps Manager, right click on the topic reference to which you want to add a key and choose Edit Properties. The Edit Reference dialog is shown.
Enter the key value in the Keys field.
Make sure to save the changes to the DITA map before attempting to insert the key reference in your topic.

section.title: Creating a link using a key
section.p: To create a link using a key:

ol.li: In Author mode, highlight the text you want to be a link.
Click the link button on the DITA toolbar and select Key Reference.... The Insert Key Reference dialog is displayed.
Use the filter field to find the key you want to link to, then select it and click Insert and close. They link will be created in your topic.
